name: April Fools' Problem (hard)
description:
The plans for HC^2 are rather far-fetched: we are just over 500 000 days away
from HC^2 3387, for example, and accordingly we are planning to have a couple
hundred thousand problems in that edition (we hope that programming contests
will become wildly more popular). The marmots need to get to work, and they
could use a good plan... Input Same as the medium version, but the limits have
changed: 1 ≤ k ≤ n ≤ 500 000. Output Same as the medium version. Example Input
8 4 3 8 7 9 9 4 6 8 2 5 9 4 3 8 9 1 Output 32
